p: In Fig. 4b, we plot the relative volumetric changes of the dynamic observation window and of the active graphite particles as a function of the flowed specific charge. The overall electrode expands by almost 7% (blue curve), consistent with our findings in Fig. 3b, and the particles (black curve in Fig. 4b) expand by more than 10%, in excellent agreement with literature where it is reported that the crystal lattice of graphite expands predominantly along its c-axis direction by approximately 10.5% on a full lithiation 1 18 19. The porosity (red curve) first slightly decreases from 48 to 46%, but then remains at 46% for the second half of the lithiation because the particles expand more than the overall electrode only during the first half of lithiation.
